pageContext.claim: “No other President has done this, Zippy. I'll tell you, you can go back to Abraham Lincoln and there's no President that's treated the farmers like Trump. I don't know, I hear we're doing well with the farmers, but I can't imagine -- I want to find out who wouldn't be -- who wouldn't be with Trump, right?”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has stiff competition from many former presidents — many of whom were farmers. Franklin Delano Roosevelt initiated policies to help manage boom and bust cycles. Abraham Lincoln created the U.S. Department of Agriculture and the land-grant college system. Trump stakes his claim on the subsidies that he has procured from China, but it was also his trade dispute that led farmers to need subsidies in the first place.
